author: A_Brickset_user
title: Another Great Minifig
review: I really dig the black visor. I previously hadn't owned a 3-wheeler, so it was definitely worth buying for so cheap! 3.75! I'm happy. I also agree with the first review, having everything black is fun to messs around with. I replaced the head with a skull, he looks like ghost rider or something.

author: CyandraZ
title: Fun little kit.
review: Biker Bob may be a freebee, but he's actually pretty cool, despite his crazy 3 wheeled bike. The exclusive face is cool, what with the beard and the silver glasses, and I like his torso. And again, since the kit was free with my copy of Lego Creator, I can't really take more than one point off for the design. Of course, it's not worth buying it, but it's okay free. 4/5

author: unitron6991
title: Priceless face
review: This came include with my LEGO Creator CD-ROM. I think this guy has one of the best faces of any minifig. No othe minifig has glasses like that. The flames coming out of the trike is a nice touch. Essential for any town.

author: Nesquik
title: Brilliant Biker Bob
review:
Arriving as a nice free package within the 'LEGO Creator' CD-ROM box, 'Biker Bob' is another resident of the City who we all wish to know more about, but seems to hide away these days. I've always compared Bob to another character of the same name; Boba Fett from the Star Wars saga... Mysterious, and ultimately cool!

With just 18 pieces (minus the Minifig) this is a typical micro-set that you would expect to find in the 1990's with promotional offers or at any one of the LegoLand parks themselves. This makes sets such as this charming and unique - they're hard to find today, and I like the fact that the subject matter has so much playability and can be placed in any City.

The minifig of Bob himself is a big talking point as he has a very rare headpiece that features striking 'goatee' facial hair and equally nice sunshades, of which again, I have yet to see on another minifig. The torso has three zip patterns, whilst the hands and legs are plain black, as is his helmet. 

As mentioned in another review, the flames coming out of the exhausts are a really nice touch and give the impression of great life within Bob's bike. I'd like to think that because of mysterious nature and the rarity associated with him that those flames hint at a very special bike...

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town - Biker Bob
review:
The Biker Bob (2584) is a LEGO Town set which came out in 1998. It comes with 1 minifig and 15 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/2584-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Biker Bob: Biker Bob comes with a black helmet with a black visor, black pants and a black jacket. The torso and the face with the silver shades and the cool looking beard are unique to this set.

Motorcycle:

The motorcycle is very easy to build and looks very cool. The steering wheel does sviwel and on the front is a headlight and there's a light on the back. There're also 2 flames for the engine on the back.

This set came with the videogame 'LEGO Creator'. It's a good addition to your LEGO City and the black motorcycle is very cool. The build is quick. I don't think that you'll need longer than 5 minutes to put this small set together.



Positive:

Great pieces which you can use for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifig is unique
No stickers
Nice starter set


Negative:

No play features
Too easy to build




All in all this set is a good model and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Review

author: Fauch
title: Cool motorbike
review:
I got this set for free with lego creator, so I can't really judge the value for money. Moreover I have no idea what it is worth today.

This is the first and only lego motorbike of this kind I got. It looked really cool and I think it still looks pretty good compared to modern standard. I got my first motorbikes with the 1992 shuttle launching crew, but this one looks much more powerful, being bigger. Also, it's black.

The minifig being entirely black (even the visor) was really cool back in the day, though I guess it's nothing special nowadays, except maybe the head piece which could be rare (I have no idea actually).

I recently found out something cool with this set. I was browsing random instructions on that site, and realized that the motorbike pieces in this set are used to build modern lego star wars speeder bikes. Actually, you can disconnect the front part of the motorbike with the wheel and handlebar, and instead you connect the front of your speeder bike. then you remove the 2 back wheels and use plates with clip on top to attach skis. I made my own with spare pieces, mostly pieces from the 1999 speeder bikes set.

Note that if you buy one of those star wars speeder bikes sets, be careful which pieces it comes with. it is possible it only comes with the back side of the motorbike, which would mean you can't actually turn your speeder bike into a regular motorbike.
